data.title: Ripped us off
data.text: Booked with my choice hotel points. The policy on the choice site is the motel will hold the room until 7am the following morning of arrival date. I had a print out with this policy with my reservation info. We drove all night and just needed to sleep for 4 hours. I had noted that we would be very late.. They did not hold the room for us. The manager saw the policy that i had printed and still told the girl working the desk to tell me NO and he would not even come speak with me about this. So they then charged us $171.00 to sleep in a disgusting, filthy room for 4 hours.. I complained to choice twice and they at least got my points back for me but still out  $171 and we gave them a AAA card and they just didnt bother to give us that discount either. Just the stress I needed when trying to celebrate being 1 year cancer free by taking a beach trip with my best friends... We wouldnt even shower there in the morning because the tub looked so dirty and the AC is loud and blows right on you while you sleep.

data.title: Deplorable!!!!!!!!
data.text: Soiled furniture molded bathroom tiles and fixtures. Mgmt wasnt able to address issues be cause they were hiding in backroom while i was voicing the complaint .  WiFi didn't work    thus place needs a complete makeover they need help ASAP

data.title: Double charged me and hasn't returned my money.
data.text: I reserved this room on hotels.com for a quick trip to take my son to a doctors appointment.   When i received my credit card statement I discovered that the hotel had also charged me.  The hotel has not refunded me nor had hotels.com refunded me.

data.title: Disgusting, Gross and Hideous
data.text: This hotel was booked with Hotels.com. Upon arrival, I found that this hotel did not have hot continental breakfast (which I requested). Me and my family entered the room and began to wipe down with lysol the toilet, tub, sink, tv remote and other known items that are normally touched while staying in a hotel. The white rag was so nasty, it was disgusting. The environment was filled with what appeared to be drug addicts and I literally feared for the safety of my family. The hotel was infested with roaches. The bathtub was stained with dirt. The comforters was so nasty I literally cannot explain the grossness. I will never use Hotel.com ever in my life again. I would advise anyone to not disregard this review while booking a room at this location. There were cock roaches crawling on the floor and the carpet was stained with vomit. I tried to cancel this reservation through hotels.com and was informed that the hotel would not issue a refund. I did not stay in this room over 1 hour before I ran from this hotel and booked at the Hyatt Regency on Greenbriar near the mall.

data.title: room was good
data.text: The room was very large and the beds were comfortable. The WiFi was not good. My bathroom door did not shut due to the door frame being busted. The bathtub was big but stopper was no good. Had to use a washcloth. Breakfast was not much at all. Housekeeping was great. Super friendly. Close to stores and food. I would stay again.

data.title: GROSS! At your peril!
data.text: Absolutely the worst. We were booked here at the last minute by a family member, since we needed three rooms for one night during a very long driving trip. The highway approach is filled with strip clubs and pawn shops. Arrived to a frightening check-in with a drugged out patron in the lobby, disgusting run-down public areas and surly service. As the first to arrive with children, I got the key for one of the rooms. Opened the door to a run-down, filthy room with cracked sinks, bugs in the bathroom, torn curtains and stained rugs and immediately left. I called family members to tell them not to check in. After finding another hotel, I returned to the front desk and explained we would not be staying in the hotel and that they could charge us for one of the rooms, but not all three. We were told to check in with the "manager" in the morning. Bottom line: the next day, the manager Cris told us that the credit card had been charged for THREE ROOMS and there was absolutely no recourse. We could call the Better Business Bureau, their corporate offices or my Aunt MaryEllen to complain -- they didn't care if we complained and would not refund the charges for three rooms we did not stay in. Run, run away people! You'd be safer and cleaner if you stayed in your car. Don't do it. Nobody should be that desperate. This place should be condemned and their staff should be ashamed of themselves.

data.title: Infested with roaches
data.text: The hotel was infested with roaches. I reached out to front desk for assistance with the management department and the representative could not locate him. However, I was given another room but we want our money back.

data.title: This place is large and clean and affordable.
data.text: I came to Chesapeake to work, and the most affordable places were not to my standards, kinda of shocking. Some were Daysinn,  Quality Inn and Ceder Ridge. I have been staying in Econo lodge since I was a kid, and they have never let me down. It was further than the others but worth it.  Nice bed,big screen flat tv and very spacious rooms.

data.title: Good for a night
data.text:
I stayed here for one night while passing through Virginia.  I had a comfortable second-floor room in which I slept well.  Despite being close to the highway the place was quiet.  In the morning a basic breakfast was available.
On arrival I found that the ac in my room did not work but it was quickly fixed.  I was not happy with the television set, closed captioning was displayed on all channels and could not be switched off; I mentioned this to the manager who promised to try to fix it but did not do so.
A satisfactory place for a one-night stop and I would use it again.  It is a long time since I stayed at an Econo Lodge and I thought it muich better than they used to be.

data.title: Large clean room
data.text:
Room was very spacious and clean.  Beds were quite comfortable.  Only thing I didn't care for was the a/c when the compressor turned off the fan would turn off, so it was on and off all night long.   Actual bathroom where the bathtub/shower and toilet were located could have used a brighter bulb.
We were here for a beach trip on Labor Day weekend to Sandbridge  which is about 30-40 minutes away depending on traffic.  We were upstairs on the side by the office and that side seemed quieter than the other side which had a lot of younger folks hanging around outside drinking and even grilling under the arch that allows cars access to the rear parking lot.
Front desk was very friendly, although one guy on duty over the weekend didn't seem to speak much English.  For the price of the room on a holiday weekend it was worth it.

data.title: NEVER AGAIN......BEDBUG ALERT!!!
data.text: I will never ever stay a minute much less an hour at this motel again.  It was a last minute choice because all surrounding hotels were full.  The room reeked of smoke, there were flies flying around, the bed had hair in it and holes in the sheets.  The fridge needed more than the wipe down it received......just horrible.  We were miserable but decided to tough it out.  So sorry we did because even receiving clean sheets from the office, we were bitten all through the night by what we thought were mosquitoes only to wake and find they were bed bugs.  Now I am home drying all clothing on high heat to ensure not to infest my home.  What a miserable Labor Day this was.  Thanks Econo Lodge!!!

data.title: Good stay for the price
data.text: I've stayed at Econo Lodge Chesapeake multiple times while traveling on business. The management and hotel staff was always very friendly and helpful to me. Rooms were decently clean, no bugs. Some people staying here seem to hang around the place; not sure about the surrounding area but I always felt safe here. Ice machine didn't work when I was there. Breakfast was very slim - basically a pack of muffins, donuts, and coffee. I would return just for a night or two.

data.title: Stay away or you will be robbed!
data.text: Don't stay here!  This was a dirty, smoke infested hotel (even in the "non smoking" rooms) in a dangerous part of town.  The manager is a con-artist who will run your credit card multiple times if you aren't careful - so check your bank statement after you leave.  He even admitted to me over the phone two separate times that he was at fault and he would issue me a refund, yet here I am 2 months later waiting for my money.  Now when I call the other people behind the desk tell me he is unavailable and I've had to go through a lengthy dispute process with my bank to try and get made whole.  Do yourself a favor and find another hotel!

data.title: Rooms were clean, there was a microwave and frig!
data.text:
My husband and I needed a one night stay on our way to SC. We checked reviews for this hotel and decided to try it. Got a great rate thru my union which made it even better! We checked in late, but our room was ready for us. Clean room. Bonus was the frig, we had a small cooler that we unloaded into it. There was also a microwave. No elevator, but we only had a couple of bags.
I had heard that the free breakfast was very minimal, so we checked out and found breakfast elsewhere. But it was quiet in a quiet part of town. The hotel was very full (sign at check said they were full, no rooms available). Very good experience.

data.title: BEDBUGS  BEDBUGS
data.text: When we checked in I was happy with the custome service, and the cleanliness of the room, but it was the next day when we checked out and I arrived at the beach I realized my child and I were bitten by bedbugs.  I called the hotel and complained, and all I got was denial, and since we had alrteady checked out I couldn't prove it to them.  Unless you like bedbugs don't stay here especially in room 209.

data.title: Great Value For Money
data.text:
Stayed in hotel for 2 nights and was pleasantly surprised by the how clean the hotel is
  Front desk staff are very friendly and housekeepers did a good job.
Next time we are in city that's the place we will be staying.

data.title: IT CAN WORK FOR YOU
data.text: This is a decent stop on any budget traveler's itinerary.   We did not get the best welcome from employee in charge of the place.  My Choice Elite Status did not help to get me, an old man, with his elderly wife an "upgrade" to a ground floor room . . .  the check-in man insisted on $19 extra for ground floor . . .  I decided to drag our bags up a flight of steps to save the money for a one night stand. :-)  Our room and bath were okay, clean, great hot water, thank you, EconoLodge Chesapeake VA!

data.title: You can picture an episode of CSI being filmed here.
data.text:
In the end it was the AAA rate of $44 that convinced me to stay here. On the plus side there were no smells, no bugs, the bed was comfortable and the room was clean. 
On the other hand the neighborhood was not all that nice and the continental breakfast was coffee, juice and pastries in cellophane that looked like the kind stocked for vending machines. We skipped dinner and left astonishingly early the next morning, with me slapping my forehead for not booking a nicer hotel. P.S. Our breakfast was from a Dunkin' Donuts our Garmin GPU was kind enough to point out. P.P.S. It was my wife who quipped that the property looked like a murder scene from C.S.I.

data.title: Decent Hotel for the Price Range
data.text:
I needed a cheap place to crush for the night before early morning hunting in nearby woods.  This place was on the bottom end of the price list with decent rating.  Exterior and lobby of the place are nice.  During check-in, the guy didn't know the reservation was already paid through hotels.com and asked for the price that was lower than I've paid here.  Made me think that service fee tacked on here is suspicious.
Free wi-fi was a nice touch. It required web authentication, but was very fast. It provided me with entertainment & TV since cable TV in the room was "very basic".
The room was of expected quality in this price range.  Somewhat aging decor with armchair, desk, old TV, fridge, microwave, and some sort of bench.  However, there were no coffeemaker.  I guess that was because they offer free "breakfast" in the lobby at 6:00am. The bed was OK, but I found bathroom to be too small for my taste.  Overall, there were no unpleasant surprises, so I would recommend this hotel.

data.title: I Was Warned By Previous Reviews, But I Was Desperate
data.text: Although the hotel room is nicely decorated it has some serious underlying problems.  The first room we were assigned to smelled badly when we opened the door.  It smelled like bad body odor.  Then we cut the lamp on that was on the table.  When we cut it on two small roaches crawled across the table.  We quickly left the room and shut the door.  We went back to the office and reported the problem.  The desk clerk/owner acted as though he was stunned by the news.  We then asked for another room.  He quickly obliged.  That room was roach free.  Unfortunately it was also hot water free and heat free. Because this was an unexpected emergency stay and was only for overnight we endured it.  Both desk clerks (night and morning) appeared cold and distant in character.  Warm, friendly, and appreciative employees would somewhat help.
